info: Derived from Arabic الأخضر (al-ʾAkhḍar) meaning "the green".
Form of Al-Amin used in parts of French-influenced West and North Africa.
Means "gentle, kind" in Arabic. In Islamic tradition اللطيف (al-Laṭīf) is one of the 99 names of Allah.
Alternate transcription of Arabic لقمان (see Luqman), as well as the usual Indonesian form.
Meaning unknown. This is the name of a wise man mentioned several times in the Quran. The Quran's 31st chapter (surah Luqman) is named for him.
Means "kind, gentle" in Arabic, a derivative of لطف (laṭafa) meaning "to be kind".
